japaneseArtists.name: Katsushika Hokusai
japaneseArtists.quote: The spirit of nature is always greater than the artist's perception of it.
japaneseArtists.influence: Katsushika Hokusai is one of Japan's most iconic artists, whose work transcended borders and influenced countless Western artists. His famous woodblock print, 'The Great Wave off Kanagawa,' became a symbol of Japanese art worldwide. Hokusai's mastery in portraying natural forces and his innovative techniques had a profound impact on the Impressionist movement in Europe, particularly inspiring artists like Claude Monet and Vincent van Gogh.
